column4: to surf at work I use putty to create a "proxy" through secure ssh is there a way that I can check how much trafic I have while surfing like this?
to surf at work I use putty to create a "proxy" through secure ssh is there a way that I can check how much trafic I generate while surfing like this?
perhaps install and run 'iptraf' (or a similar util) on the relevant machine?
so I install this on my server?
sure. i always start with 'iptraf' to monitor any network stuff. i love iptraf. i'd install it on all machines if you can :-)
is there a way to do this just monitoring 1 port in particular?
let me look at iptraf's options.. hang on
is this also good for commandline only?
yes. iptraf is an ncurses command line util. i'm not sure i see a way in it to monitor just one single port. but there may be a way to do it
ok I will take a look into it
once installed does it run by default or do you have to start it each time?
thought you where takling to me when you wrote in?
nope. asking for help with sound problem and i'm addressing the channel in my post ;-)
you might want to try asking in a bash channel. it's probably #bash or ##bash
